abstract.p: New York Times Co announces that Todd Haskell, vice president for business development for media group, will take on added responsibility of advertising on New York Times Web site; advertising group directors--Louis Fabrizio and Brian Garnock--are named vice presidents, advertising (S)

block.p: The New York Times Company announced yesterday that Todd Haskell, the vice president for business development for the media group, will take on the added responsibility of advertising on The New York Times Web site.

Mr. Haskell, 38, will oversee sales and advertising for nytimes.com and will play a crucial role in helping the company expand its digital advertising as it seeks more revenue from nonprint sources. He will report to Denise F. Warren, a senior vice president and chief advertising officer for The New York Times Media Group.

The New York Times Company announced yesterday that Todd Haskell, the vice president for business development for the media group, will take on the added responsibility of advertising on The New York Times Web site.

Mr. Haskell, 38, will oversee sales and advertising for nytimes.com and will play a crucial role in helping the company expand its digital advertising as it seeks more revenue from nonprint sources. He will report to Denise F. Warren, a senior vice president and chief advertising officer for The New York Times Media Group.

He became vice president for business development in December 2005. Previously, he was executive director for business development at The Times newspaper. From 1994 to 2004 he held various positions at the Meredith Corporation.
Also yesterday, the Times company said that two advertising group directors -- Louis Fabrizio and Brian Garnock -- have each been named vice president, advertising.

Mr. Fabrizio will be responsible for managing advertising sales in hotels, transportation, pharmaceuticals, hospitals, alcoholic beverages and packaged goods. Mr. Garnock will handle technology and telecommunications advertising sales.

Mr. Garnock, 32, who began his career at The Times Company in 1997, was named an advertising group director in 2006 after having served as an account manager and a managing director of technology advertising. Mr. Fabrizio, 53, began his career at the company in 1979, becoming a group director in 2006 after holding several positions at The Santa Rosa Press Democrat.
